attributes.name: ai_literacy
attributes.description: Degree of understanding of AI systems, machine learning concepts, and their societal implications (0–1 scale), grounded in prior tech exposure and education.

attributes.name: asi_belief
attributes.description: Person's belief about whether the demonstrated ASI is real and as capable as claimed (Fully believes, Mostly believes, Skeptical, Thinks it's fabricated/overhyped).

attributes.name: job_automation_risk_perception
attributes.description: Person's perceived likelihood that their own job or livelihood will be made redundant by ASI within 12 months (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: asi_emotional_response
attributes.description: Dominant emotional orientation toward the ASI event (Excited/Hopeful, Anxious/Fearful, Angry/Resentful, Indifferent, Mixed).

attributes.name: asi_governance_stance
attributes.description: Preferred policy stance on how ASI should be governed (Immediate global moratorium, Strict national regulation, Light-touch oversight, Full open access, No opinion).

attributes.name: chronic_illness_in_household
attributes.description: Whether any household member currently has a serious chronic illness (cancer, Alzheimer's, ALS, diabetes, HIV, etc.) that ASI-developed cures could directly address.

attributes.name: asi_cure_personal_stake
attributes.description: Degree to which the person has personal or familial stake in ASI-developed medical breakthroughs (0 = none, 1 = directly life-altering for self or close family member).

attributes.name: financial_resilience
attributes.description: Ability to financially weather economic disruption from ASI-driven labor market changes, based on savings, assets, and income stability (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: tech_adoption_propensity
attributes.description: Likelihood of being an early adopter of new ASI-enabled tools, products, or services (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: existential_risk_concern
attributes.description: Level of concern that self-improving ASI poses an existential or civilizational risk to humanity (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: redistribution_preference
attributes.description: Preference for government-led redistribution of ASI-generated abundance (e.g., UBI, public ownership of AI infrastructure) vs. market-led distribution (0 = pure market, 1 = full redistribution).

attributes.name: information_seeking_intensity
attributes.description: How actively the person seeks out new information about ASI developments, cures, and societal changes after the announcement (0–1 scale).

attributes.name: social_network_asi_sentiment
attributes.description: Dominant ASI sentiment in the person's immediate social network (Mostly positive, Mostly negative, Divided, Mostly indifferent), influencing opinion formation.

input.notes: Big Five traits already exist in the base population. No context-specific attributes are needed as there is no specific brand/product relationship. The 13 new attributes focus on: (1) cognitive/inform...[truncated]
